text.wmch.title: Where's My Chat History Configuration
text.wmch.time_desc: Should the timestamp in front of all messages show? If false, all other time-related options will have no effect.
text.wmch.timeStr_desc: The text that is used for the timestamp. To add time values, see [https://i.imgur.com/KlBIDWf.png].
text.wmch.timeFormatting_desc: The array of Formattings to modify the looks of the timestamp's text. See the name values at [https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Formatting_codes].
text.wmch.hover_desc: Should the text that appears when you hover over the timestamp show? If false, all other hover-related options will have no effect.
text.wmch.hoverStr_desc: The text that shows when you hover over the timestamp in front of all chat messages. For dynamic text, see [https://i.imgur.com/KlBIDWf.png].
text.wmch.boundary_desc: Should the boundary line that shows when you use chat then leave and rejoin a game session show? If false, all other boundary-related options will have no effect.
text.wmch.boundaryStr_desc: The text that is shown when a boundary line is inserted into the chat.
text.wmch.boundaryFormatting_desc: The array of Formattings to modify the looks of the boundary text. See the name values at [https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Formatting_codes].
text.wmch.maxMsgs_desc: The max amount of chat messages allowed to render. Not recommended to change, as it's automatically adjusted based on RAM allocation.
text.wmch.reset_desc: If this is toggled on, it will reset all options to their default values (including this one). This will exist as long as I don't know how to add a reset button.
